items.title: Output before Input #50 - 2022.02.27
items.content_html:
ðŸŽµ Output before Input #50 - 2022.02.27

I’m not sure how far I thought I was going to take this, but 50 seems like a milestone! I’m celebrating with this incredibly soft, rounded, understated melody. Look: I don’t control what comes out - when you roll out of bed + pick up a guitar, what happens: happens.
items.content_text:
ðŸŽµ [Output before Input](https://dl.merand.org/output-before-input/) #50 - 2022.02.27

<audio controls="controls" src="https://dl.merand.org/uploads/2022/8e3355bc81.m4a" preload="metadata" />

items.content_html: These garden ties are by far the best computer cable ties I’ve ever found. They can be cut to a perfect length, they’re easy on the hands, they clamp quickly, and they’re incredibly cheap relative to computer-specific ties.
items.content_text: These garden ties are by far the best computer cable ties I've ever found. They can be cut to a perfect length, they're easy on the hands, they clamp quickly, and they're incredibly cheap relative to computer-specific ties.

items.title: Output before Input #1 - 2022.01.14
items.content_html:
ðŸŽµ Output before Input #1 - 2022.01.14

I’m often inspired by Tom Sach’s work. Recently I read about his philosophy of output before input, which is evidently something he learned from my quantitative design hero Edward Tufte.

I’ve started a daily “output before input” ritual for my guitar playing. Each morning that I successfully get out of bed without looking at my phone, I sit at my electric guitar and do a quick improvisation, usually 2-3 minutes in length. I’ve done enough now that I feel confident sharing them as their own category, and I’ll keep it up for as long as it bears something interesting to me. Hopefully anybody who listens will find it interesting as well.

Here’s the podcast on Pocket Casts, as a standard podcast feed, and as an Apple Podcasts-compatible link.
items.content_text:
ðŸŽµ [Output before Input](https://dl.merand.org/output-before-input/) #1 - 2022.01.14

I'm often inspired by Tom Sach's [work](http://tenbullets.com). Recently I read about his philosophy of [output before input](https://www.gq.com/story/tom-sachs-rules-for-creating), which is evidently something he learned from my quantitative design hero [Edward Tufte](https://edwardtufte.com).

I've started a daily "output before input" ritual for my guitar playing. Each morning that I successfully get out of bed without looking at my phone, I sit at my electric guitar and do a quick improvisation, usually 2-3 minutes in length. I've done enough now that I feel confident sharing them as their own category, and I'll keep it up for as long as it bears something interesting to me. Hopefully anybody who listens will find it interesting as well.

Here's the podcast on [Pocket Casts](https://pca.st/fux2igjj), as a standard [podcast feed](https://dl.merand.org/podcast.xml), and as an [Apple Podcasts-compatible link](itpc://dl.merand.org/podcast.xml).

<audio controls="controls" src="https://dl.merand.org/uploads/2022/22e1a347cb.m4a" preload="metadata" />

items.content_html: For those of you who eat peanut butter that needs stirring: store your peanut butter upside-down. It reduced my stirring time from ~10 minutes to ~1 minute. All credit for this idea goes to my partner, but she doesn’t have a blog so I’m writing here because people need to know.
items.content_text: For those of you who eat peanut butter that needs stirring: **store your peanut butter upside-down**. It reduced my stirring time from ~10 minutes to ~1 minute. All credit for this idea goes to my partner, but she doesn't have a blog so I'm writing here because *people need to know*.

items.content_html: Looking over my old 3d-printed designs, this is my favorite: www.thingiverse.com/thing:140… . Convert any table into a drafting table with a rolling paper surface! I was particularly proud that it can be entirely 3d-printed on a small bed.
items.content_text: Looking over my old 3d-printed designs, this is my favorite: [www.thingiverse.com/thing:140...](https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:1404307) . Convert any table into a drafting table with a rolling paper surface! I was particularly proud that it can be entirely 3d-printed on a small bed.

items.content_html:
Words of encouragement from Frederick P. Brooks, Jr:

Systems program building is an entropy-decreasing process, hence inherently metastable. Program maintenance is an entropy increasing process, and even its most skillful execution only delays the subsidence of the system into unfixable obsolescence.
items.content_text:
Words of encouragement from Frederick P. Brooks, Jr:

items.content_html: For all of the vegan, gluten-free, non-fermented folks out there, my killer condiments are Bragg’s soy aminos for salty/funky, coconut aminos for sweet, and freshly-squeezed lemon, sumac, or pomegranate molasses for acid.
items.content_text: For all of the vegan, gluten-free, non-fermented folks out there, my killer condiments are Bragg's soy aminos for salty/funky, coconut aminos for sweet, and freshly-squeezed lemon, sumac, or pomegranate molasses for acid.

items.content_html: Try cutting sugar entirely out of your diet and replacing it with more vegetables. You’ll be so well-adjusted you won’t know what to do with yourself.
items.content_text: Try cutting sugar entirely out of your diet and replacing it with more vegetables. You'll be so well-adjusted you won't know what to do with yourself.

items.content_html:
Even if the bowl is broken (and the bowl is broken), from the clay and the making and the firing and the pattern, even if the pattern is incomplete (and the pattern is incomplete), let the mind draw its energy. Let the heart complete the pattern.

Ursula Le Guin, Always Coming Home

items.content_html: I’m not sure when this happened, but the media controls in Windows 10 suddenly seem to work with Firefox. It’s a small thing, but it’s so nice that I can pause/play or change tracks/volume from the keyboard or trackpad while I’m streaming music or video.

items.content_html: I love making granola flavors that nobody would ever sell; today’s batch was pumpkin, chia, and flax seed with dried Asian pear, sun butter, and maple syrup. Basically using up pantry items but it’s really quite good.

items.content_html:
This article wonderfully explains why vim is so appealling.

I hadn’t considered how composability is the unifying theme that binds most of my favorite software, but it seems obvious now that it’s been stated. To me, that’s the hallmark of an elegant idea.
items.content_text:
[This article](https://medium.com/@mkozlows/why-atom-cant-replace-vim-433852f4b4d1) wonderfully explains why vim is so appealling.

I hadn't considered how composability is the unifying theme that binds most of my favorite software, but it seems obvious now that it's been stated. To me, that's the hallmark of an elegant idea.

items.content_html: If I had known how easy it is to back up Google Drive and other cloud services to a Synology NAS, I would have purchased one years ago! They even do a thing where they convert docs to MS Office equivalents, which is crucial.
